form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Brown (for himself, Mr. Boozman, Mr. Durbin, and Mr. Casey) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Designating July 2014 as Summer Meals Awareness Month.

whereas.text: Whereas 1 in 5 children in the United States struggle with hunger;
Whereas research has found that more than 30 percent of low-income families do not have enough food during the summer months;

Whereas the summer food service program for children established under section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act ( 42 U.S.C. 1761 ) exists to ensure that low-income children have access to adequate nutrition when the school year ends;

Whereas summer programs are often under-utilized, as only 1 in 6 eligible children participate in the summer food service program, due in part to families being unaware that the summer food service program exists;
Whereas lack of transportation and other barriers often prevent children from accessing the summer food service program sites, especially in rural areas; and

Whereas almost 1 in 3 low-income children live in communities that are not eligible to participate in the summer food service program, thus reducing their ability to participate in the program: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: designates July 2014 as Summer Meals Awareness Month;

encourages members of Congress, schools, local businesses, nonprofit institutions, churches, cities, and State governments to assist in efficient use of summer food service program sites by raising awareness of the location and availability of those sites;

encourages members of Congress, schools, local businesses, nonprofit institutions, churches, cities, and State governments to support efforts to increase the participation rate of eligible children who, without the summer food service program for children established under section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act ( 42 U.S.C. 1761 ), may go without meals; and
encourages members of Congress to visit a summer food service program site to see the importance of the program firsthand.
